text: Byers is a city in Pratt County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 38 people lived there. ==History== Byers was created in 1914. It was named after Otto Phillip Byers. The first post office in Byers was created in April 1915. ==Geography== Byers is at (37.787896, -98.867055). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 38 people, 15 households, and 11 families living in Byers. The median age was 28.7 years. Of the people, 89.5% were White and 10.5% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 10.5% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 35 people, 15 households, and 9 families living in Byers. ===2000 census=== The 2000 census says that there were 50 people, 20 households, and 18 families living in Byers. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Byers - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 438, local school district ;Maps * Byers City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Pratt County, Kansas Category:1914 establishments in the United States
title: Byers, Kansas
